body_html:
We fully adhere to RFC 4180 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180) in the tf.decode_csv function.
(I couldn't find anything in RFC 2048, section 2.6 about CSV... I assume that was a typo? Feel free to link me to a different RFC if there is one @PForet)

However, the issue here is that TextLineDataset splits the file on all linebreaks, regardless of whether it's encapsulated in quotations (before any notion of CSV is introduced), so the decode_csv function receives an incomplete record as input. I'm working on a fused reading + parsing dataset type that will fix this issue.

However, the issue here is that TextLineDataset splits the file on all linebreaks, regardless of whether it's encapsulated in quotations (before any notion of CSV is introduced), so the decode_csv function receives an incomplete record as input. I'm working on a fused reading + parsing dataset type that will fix this issue.
body:
We fully adhere to RFC 4180 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180) in the `tf.decode_csv` function.
(I couldn't find anything in RFC 2048, section 2.6 about CSV... I assume that was a typo? Feel free to link me to a different RFC if there is one @PForet) 

However, the issue here is that `TextLineDataset` splits the file on all linebreaks, regardless of whether it's encapsulated in quotations (before any notion of CSV is introduced), so the `decode_csv` function receives an incomplete record as input. I'm working on a fused reading + parsing dataset type that will fix this issue.
